response_parsed.title: Securing Microservices with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of how to implement security measures in FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Use FastAPI's built-in authentication and authorization mechanisms like OAuth2, JWT, Basic Auth, API Key, and cookie-based session management
Implement input validation to ensure the integrity of incoming data
Follow best practices for secure coding such as parameterizing queries, using prepared statements, and minimizing the exposure of sensitive information
Leverage dependency injection for easier testing and maintenance
Utilize FastAPI's middleware for global handling of requests and responses
Implement HTTPS and use a valid SSL certificate for secure communication

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends, HTTPException
app = FastAPI()
... # Implement OAuth2 authentication

version_notes: Ensure you have FastAPI and its dependencies installed: pip install fastapi[all]
caveats: Always keep your packages updated to stay secure
Follow best practices for security, including keeping sensitive data encrypted at rest and in transit
Never store passwords or API keys in plain text; use environment variables or secret management services
